website_summaries.verdict: A well made kiln that's small on size but big on results.
pros: Compact and lightweight size makes it easy to carry and store
cons: Doesn't come with any extra accessories, despite being a 'beginners" kit
Could be too small for larger projects

customer_reviews.title: Really fun and instant gratification
customer_reviews.text: So far I have had reasonable success with this microwave kiln. I'm just now honing my techniques, and advise anyone who uses these to view the plethora of great YouTube videos available online about fusing glass jewelry (Glaze Jewellery in New Zealand) and about fushing glass in general (aaeglass). There are others, too, but these are my favorite sites for technique and inspiration. I've shown my very first piece, a kitty pendant for my niece. aaeglass also has a very good selection of glass decals that you fire onto the surface of your finished fused glass. They work very well, and the technique is demonstrated on YouTube and probably their website as well.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Mini Klin
customer_reviews.text: Best way to start out fusing glass. Light weight, easy to carry, easy directions. All the way great. Love it Love it Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Bead Lady

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend this product unless u want a big mess.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for Christmas and I was very excited to get to use it; however when I made a practice project it went horribly wrong. I am a very careful person I read the instructions carefully and re-read them. I made sure I had 90 Coe glass and I didn't mix glass types. I made a simple project put it in and when I fired it, it melted way too much and I took it out to let it cool and when it was cool the glass was stuck to the sides and won't come off. I'm very unhappy that I did everything i was supposed to and the kiln created this problem.
customer_reviews.author: D.V.

customer_reviews.title: however it felt like I'd been ripped off when opened and found just ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what I expected, but this was really disappointing. I have looked at this and read the description many times; however it felt like I'd been ripped off when opened and found just the tiny kiln, no supplies or beginner's materials or even a booklet to instruct the beginner for the huge price. I am rethinking this hobby and wondering if it is worth the cost along with the frustration of learning.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing, but serviceable.
customer_reviews.text: I must not have read the description closely enough, because this is a VERY small kiln. I know they can't be too big for a microwave, but the interior space on this is disappointing. It was also rather disappointing to find that I could not use it straight out of the box; I had to make a separate purchase of kiln paper. They should have at least included a small piece for the price of this kiln. Shop carefully.

customer_reviews.title: Hours of enjoyment
customer_reviews.text: This is my second kiln. I had fused literally hundreds of dichroic pieces in the first one. The first kiln was working just fine until a cabochon that was being fired, split and the pieces moved to the edge of the kiln and fused onto the side. Entirely my fault and no fault of the kiln. I immediately sent for another kiln. I love the kiln. I will be ordering yet another if the second one suffers a similar fate.

customer_reviews.title: Glass Not Included
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. The biggest disappointment was that there were no practice pieces or starter kit included. The purchase of a glass starter kit can run you as much as twice the amount of the kiln if you don't shop around. Don't plan on giving this to a child, it will be an expensive dust collector in no time.
customer_reviews.author: BGS

customer_reviews.title: Small
customer_reviews.text: I returned this product, it turned out to be much smaller than I anticipated, was very disappointed. Was a bit pricey especially for the size of the kiln.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product!
customer_reviews.text: I rarely include products in the books I write, but in my upcoming book The Big A** Book of Bling (Simon and Schuster) I used this exact kiln for an entire chapter. This kiln is absolutely amazing and a perfect tool for someone interested in learning something new and interesting. I was able to make beautiful glass pieces quite easily in very little time. It's easy to use, has endless possibilities and if you just follow the very simple instructions, you'll have beautiful, professional glass pieces immediately. I LOVE this product and I think it's well worth the investment. I promise you will love it, too. Mark Montano
customer_reviews.author: Mark Montano

customer_reviews.title: good for the price
customer_reviews.text: This kiln is a good starter. It's hard to get accurate results. It heats everything closest to the walls first, so anything in the center will take longer, possibly resulting in uneven fusing. It gets things done, I can't complain about that. And it's good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen
